## Fisher information

Let $Y_1,...,Y_n \overset{iid}{\sim} Poisson(\lambda)$. The log-likelihood is

$$\ell_n(\lambda) = -n \lambda + \log(\lambda) \sum \limits_{i=1}^n Y_i - \log\left( \prod \limits_{i=1}^n Y_i! \right)$$

and we have previously shown that the MLE is $\widehat{\lambda} = \frac{1}{n} \sum \limits_{i=1}^n Y_i$.

1. Compute $Var(\widehat{\lambda})$.

\vspace{3cm}

2. Compute $Var(\ell_n'(\lambda))$, and compare with your answer to question 1.


\vspace{4cm}

3. Compute $-\mathbb{E}[\ell_n''(\lambda)]$, and compare with your answer to question 2.
